sources.data_found: Legacy hardware documentation (validating base configurations): Lists GPU nodes with Dual NVIDIA Tesla V100 32GB GPUs.
IPEDS Data (2022) for Computer Science degrees awarded: 227 Bachelors, 196 Masters, 18 Research Doctorates.
School of Engineering Undergraduate Enrollment (Fall 2023): 1,600. (Used to validate CS major estimates).

NOTS cluster has 159 nodes; 2024 expansion provided 88 million CPU core hours and 750 thousand GPU hours annually. ARIES cluster is a donation from AMD with 12 million CPU hours and 1.5 million GPU hours annually. RAPID is a small GPU-only cluster with 80 Nvidia GPUs for interactive compute.
Aries Cluster - This resource was donated by AMD, and it contains 152 MI50 GPUs and 24 MI100 GPUs. It is an excellent resource for 'big' users (those that require at least 8 GPUs at a time).
NOTS node configuration table with GPU node counts and per-node GPU models: 1 node w/ 4x A40; 3 nodes w/ 8x A40; 16 nodes w/ 2x V100; 12 nodes w/ 4x L40S.
States RANGE includes 80 NVIDIA H100 and H200 GPUs (no split or form factor given).
Repeats RAPID has 80 Nvidia GPUs and RANGE will come online with multiple Nvidia H100 and H200 GPUs (no exact breakdown).
Student enrollment: 0 undergrad, 0 grad, 0 PhD (Common Data Set does not break down by major).

student_data.notes: Exact enrollment headcounts by major are not publicly listed on the Rice CS website or Common Data Set. Counts are calculated estimates based on IPEDS 'Degrees Awarded' data sourced via DataUSA. Undergraduate estimate: 227 Bachelors degrees awarded × 4 years = 908 (Consistent with School of Engineering total of 1,600). MS/Grad estimate based on 1.5 year duration. PhD estimate based on 5.5 year duration. Claude provided lower estimates based on different scaling factors, but Gemini's higher estimates are used per aggregation rules.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Legacy nodes in commons partition (Gemini found 32, Claude found 8).

gpu_resources.notes: Aggregated data covers NOTS, RAPID, and RANGE clusters. 1) RANGE: Sources indicate 80 total H100/H200 GPUs; split estimated as 64 H100 SXM and 16 H200 based on standard node configurations. 2) RAPID: Source lists 80 Nvidia GPUs; mapped to A100 40GB based on OpenAI estimation (specific model unspecified in public docs). 3) NOTS: Combined findings include 16 A100 80GB (Gemini), 28 A40s (OpenAI), 48 L40S (OpenAI), and 32 V100s (Gemini/OpenAI agreement). 4) ARIES: AMD cluster excluded from primary NVIDIA counts but listed in 'other'.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini models. Student counts are estimates derived from graduation data. GPU counts prioritize highest findings across the distinct clusters (NOTS, RAPID, RANGE), with significant estimations made for the specific model breakdown of the RAPID and RANGE clusters.
validation_notes: No changes made. All resources appear to be owned and operated by Rice University. Student data is already estimated and appears reasonable.
